ai-atk-s0510a23:2_1: Twentying in five-footed (?), having taken the Tusita a Dhamma talk, he presented the Palace of the Simile of the Earth, after taking the Joyful Cloth, he gave the Order to the Community, took a flower of the Cloth.
ai-atk-s0510a23:3_1: Having conquered this second wealth, he created a flower thicket treasure of bowing down to the Buddha, and having seen him shaved off his hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and went to the Buddha. When he had arrived, I did an opportunity, I gained confidence in the Buddha, the Fraternity.
ai-atk-s0510a23:4_1: Third: chickens and pigs, Chickens, chickens and pigs,
ai-atk-s0510a23:4_2: (but) with the Lord of the World, having woken a lotus flower through the air, were going to the sky and worshipped the Fortunate One’s body with carrying pole.
ai-atk-s0510a23:5_1: The fourth he shakes off the flowers, like anointing a drum in garments, different to the flowers, takes arch, and burning them with a holy wheel. The meaning is this: “Seeing the sound of the Buddha.” She then took a flower of flowers, to the western head, took a flower of them by the Buddha.
ai-atk-s0510a23:6_1: Making the robe on the five months, making use of the resting place.
ai-atk-s0510a23:6_2: falling from time to time, (thinking): “The time has plenty of plucked; the meaning is good.”
ai-atk-s0510a23:6_3: (There is) the meaning of Siddhattha to see the Buddha, meaning with fragrant scented,
ai-atk-s0510a23:7_0: The sixth section on the thirty-six positions are arising.
ai-atk-s0510a23:8_1: I chopped those seven flowers, and seven wide openings of such heads, and such flowers spread out to the Buddha.
ai-atk-s0510a23:9_1: Bimbajāla flowers, she gave gifts to the Buddha’s Cloud Grove with red blossoms, prominent flowers, she gave them almsfood to the Buddha.
ai-atk-s0510a23:10_1: After grabbing the body of the tenth Rains, he offered a flower-pillar to the west, having taken a spotless flower from Kakusandha, accepted the flowers, and worshipped the Fortunate One’s various flowers.
